items.content: The move comes after fresh fighting and reports of Pakistani air strikes in Kandahar and Kabul.

items.content: Cross-border fighting between Pakistan and Taliban-ruled Afghanistan reached a fever pitch, with Pakistan carrying out airstrikes in Kabul.

items.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to a temporary ceasefire after days of deadly clashes
items.standfirst: Clashes in recent days have killed dozens of people on both sides of the border. Pakistan is grappling with militant attacks that have increased since 2021, when the Taliban seized power in Afghanistan.
items.content: Clashes in recent days have killed dozens of people on both sides of the border. Pakistan is grappling with militant attacks that have increased since 2021, when the Taliban seized power in Afghanistan.(Image credit: H. Achakzai)

items.title: Pakistan agrees to ceasefire with Afghanistan after days of bloodshed
items.standfirst: Pakistan says it has agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire with Afghanistan following days of bloody cross-border violence.
items.content: Pakistan says it has agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire with Afghanistan following days of bloody cross-border violence.

items.title: Dozens killed in fresh clashes along Afghanistan-Pakistan border
items.standfirst: Two sides declare ceasefire after Islamabad carries out retaliatory strikes on Kabul and Kandahar provinceDozens of soldiers and civilians have been killed after fresh clashes broke out along the Afghanistan-Pakistan border and Islamabad carried out retaliatory airstrikes on the Afghan capital, Kabul, and Kandahar province.The two sides declared a ceasefire by Wednesday night after the latest outbreak of violence, which came after the deadliest cross-border clashes in years over the weekend. Continue reading...
items.content: Two sides declare ceasefire after Islamabad carries out retaliatory strikes on Kabul and Kandahar provinceDozens of soldiers and civilians have been killed after fresh clashes broke out along the Afghanistan-Pakistan border and Islamabad carried out retaliatory airstrikes on the Afghan capital, Kabul, and Kandahar province.The two sides declared a ceasefire by Wednesday night after the latest outbreak of violence, which came after the deadliest cross-border clashes in years over the weekend. items.title: Pakistan, Afghanistan agree to 48-hour ceasefire after explosions heard in Kabul
items.standfirst: Pakistan and Afghanistan agreed Wednesday to a 48-hour ‚Äútemporary ceasefire‚Äù following deadly border clashes that killed more than a dozen civilians, Islamabad said. The truce, requested by Kabul, comes after Pakistani air strikes in Kandahar and Kabul provinces and marks the worst violence between the two neighbours since the Taliban seized power in 2021.
items.content: Pakistan and Afghanistan agreed Wednesday to a 48-hour ‚Äútemporary ceasefire‚Äù following deadly border clashes that killed more than a dozen civilians, Islamabad said. The truce, requested by Kabul, comes after Pakistani air strikes in Kandahar and Kabul provinces and marks the worst violence between the two neighbours since the Taliban seized power in 2021.

items.title: Fighting escalates on border between Pakistan and Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Dozens of people have been killed and injured in fighting between Pakistan and Afghan forces on the border between Pakis
items.content: Dozens of people have been killed and injured in fighting between Pakistan and Afghan forces on the border between Pakis

items.title: Long queues at border crossings amid Afghan-Pakistan clashes
items.standfirst: All border crossings between Pakistan and Afghanistan remain closed as the countries traded fire for the second time in a week.
items.content: All border crossings between Pakistan and Afghanistan remain closed as the countries traded fire for the second time in a week.

ai_summary: Pakistan and Afghanistan agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire after deadly border clashes.
Clashes resulted in dozens of deaths on both sides of the border.
Pakistan carried out airstrikes in Kabul and Kandahar province.
The ceasefire was requested by Kabul after the worst violence since 2021.
Pakistan is dealing with increased militant attacks since the Taliban took power.

items.title: One of the bodies handed over by Hamas is not that of hostage, Israel says
items.standfirst: Out of the eight bodies returned by Hamas, one is not that of a hostage but of a young Gazan man in uniform, according to Israel. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky updates us on the situation in Israel from Jerusalem.

items.title: Former Kenyan PM Raila Odinga has died aged 80
items.standfirst: Former Kenyan Prime Minister and opposition leader Raila Odinga has died aged 80, after more than 4 decades in politics.
items.content: Former Kenyan Prime Minister and opposition leader Raila Odinga has died aged 80, after more than 4 decades in politics.

items.title: Former Kenyan premier Raila Odinga, a key figure in African politics, dies at 80
items.standfirst: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga, a key figure in African politics, has died of a heart attack in India, the Devamatha Hospital in India‚Äôs Kerala State confirmed on October 15, 2025. He was 80. FRANCE 24's Emily Boyle looks back on the life of a man whose activism helped steer Kenya away from single-party rule and towards a multiparty democracy.
items.content: Former Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga, a key figure in African politics, has died of a heart attack in India, the Devamatha Hospital in India‚Äôs Kerala State confirmed on October 15, 2025. He was 80. FRANCE 24's Emily Boyle looks back on the life of a man whose activism helped steer Kenya away from single-party rule and towards a multiparty democracy.

items.title: Raila Odinga, towering Kenyan opposition figure, dies aged 80
items.standfirst: Odinga, who ran five times for presidency and had profound influence on Kenyan politics, has died in IndiaThe veteran Kenyan opposition leader Raila Odinga, who ran five times for the presidency and had a profound influence on the country‚Äôs politics, has died aged 80 in India.Odinga was in the southern city of Kochi for treatment. The Press Trust of India news agency reported that he had a cardiac arrest during a morning walk. Continue reading...

items.content: Raila Odinga, a towering figure in Kenyan politics, has died at the age of 80 after suffering a heart attack during a morning walk.

ai_summary: Raila Odinga, former Kenyan Prime Minister, died at age 80.

Odinga was a key figure in African politics for over four decades.
He ran for president five times and had a profound influence.
President Ruto led tributes to the former opposition leader.

items.content: President Trump said six "narcoterrorists" were killed in the latest strike, bringing the number of people killed in such attacks since September to at least 27.

items.title: US blows up another drug smuggling boat off Venezuela coast, says Trump
items.standfirst: Six suspected drug smugglers have been killed in a US attack on a boat near Venezuela's coast, Donald Trump has said.
items.content: Six suspected drug smugglers have been killed in a US attack on a boat near Venezuela's coast, Donald Trump has said.

items.title: US strikes another vessel off Venezuela coast, killing six
items.standfirst: President Trump said the vessel belonged to "narcoterrorists" and that it was "trafficking narcotics." US officials have not provided evidence to this claim.
items.content: President Trump said the vessel belonged to "narcoterrorists" and that it was "trafficking narcotics." US officials have not provided evidence to this claim.

items.title: Trump says six were killed in US strike on another boat allegedly carrying drugs near Venezuela
items.standfirst: UN has condemned US strikes on small boats it believes to be trafficking drugs as extrajudicial executionsDonald Trump announced on Tuesday that the United States has struck another small boat that he accuses of carrying drugs in waters off the coast of Venezuela, killing six people aboard.‚ÄúThe strike was conducted in International Waters, and six male narcoterrorists aboard the vessel were killed in the strike,‚Äù Trump said in a statement on his Truth Social social media platform. ‚ÄúNo U.S. Forces were harmed.‚Äù Continue reading...
items.content: UN has condemned US strikes on small boats it believes to be trafficking drugs as extrajudicial executionsDonald Trump announced on Tuesday that the United States has struck another small boat that he accuses of carrying drugs in waters off the coast of Venezuela, killing six people aboard.‚ÄúThe strike was conducted in International Waters, and six male narcoterrorists aboard the vessel were killed in the strike,‚Äù Trump said in a statement on his Truth Social social media platform. ‚ÄúNo U.S. Forces were harmed.‚Äù Continue reading...

ai_summary: The US struck a boat near Venezuela, killing six suspected drug smugglers.
Donald Trump stated the vessel belonged to "narcoterrorists."
US officials have not provided evidence to support the claim.
The UN has condemned US strikes as extrajudicial executions.
The strike occurred in international waters, according to Trump.

clusters.title: Syrian leader seeks reset in Russia relations in Putin meeting
clusters.neutral_headline: Syrian leader seeks reset in Russia relations in Putin meeting

items.title: Syrian leader seeks reset in Russia relations in Putin meeting
items.standfirst: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa said Wednesday he wanted to "redefine" relations with Moscow as Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted him in their first meeting since key Kremlin ally Bashar al-Assad was ousted last year. In front of the television cameras, Putin greeted Sharaa warmly at the Kremlin, but behind closed doors the Syrian leader was expected to push for Moscow to extradite Assad, who fled there after being toppled.
items.content: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa said Wednesday he wanted to "redefine" relations with Moscow as Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted him in their first meeting since key Kremlin ally Bashar al-Assad was ousted last year. In front of the television cameras, Putin greeted Sharaa warmly at the Kremlin, but behind closed doors the Syrian leader was expected to push for Moscow to extradite Assad, who fled there after being toppled.

items.title: Syria's Sharaa tells Putin he will respect past deals with Moscow
items.standfirst: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa told Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday he would honour all past deals struck between his country and Moscow, a pledge suggesting Moscow's two main military bases in Syria are safe.
items.content: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa told Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday he would honour all past deals struck between his country and Moscow, a pledge suggesting Moscow's two main military bases in Syria are safe.

items.title: Syria and Russia vow to 'redefine' relations between the two countries
items.standfirst: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa said he wanted to 'redefine' relations with Moscow as Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted him in their first meeting on October 15, 2025 since key Kremlin ally Bashar al-Assad was ousted last year. The Syrian leader was expected to push for Moscow to extradite Assad, who fled there after being toppled, and to discuss the status of Russia's prized military bases in Syria. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into what that redefinition might mean.
items.content: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa said he wanted to 'redefine' relations with Moscow as Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted him in their first meeting on October 15, 2025 since key Kremlin ally Bashar al-Assad was ousted last year. The Syrian leader was expected to push for Moscow to extradite Assad, who fled there after being toppled, and to discuss the status of Russia's prized military bases in Syria. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into what that redefinition might mean.

items.title: Syrian president in first visit to Moscow as former enemies hold talks
items.standfirst: Ahmed al-Sharaa in effort to diversify alliances while Putin seeks to safeguard military interests in SyriaThe Syrian president, Ahmed al-Sharaa, travelled to Moscow on Wednesday for talks with Vladimir Putin, marking their first meeting since the fall of the Kremlin ally Bashar al-Assad and his subsequent exile in Russia.The talks underscored Moscow‚Äôs efforts to safeguard its military foothold in Syria and forge relations with the new rulers in Damascus, with both sides taking a pragmatic approach despite having been enemies only a year ago. Continue reading...
items.content: Ahmed al-Sharaa in effort to diversify alliances while Putin seeks to safeguard military interests in SyriaThe Syrian president, Ahmed al-Sharaa, travelled to Moscow on Wednesday for talks with Vladimir Putin, marking their first meeting since the fall of the Kremlin ally Bashar al-Assad and his subsequent exile in Russia.The talks underscored Moscow‚Äôs efforts to safeguard its military foothold in Syria and forge relations with the new rulers in Damascus, with both sides taking a pragmatic approach despite having been enemies only a year ago. Continue reading...

items.title: Syria seeks to ‚Äòredefine‚Äô Russia ties, al-Sharaa tells Putin in Moscow
items.standfirst: Syria's interim leader assures the Russian president that his government will honour all past agreements with Moscow.
items.content: Syria's interim leader assures the Russian president that his government will honour all past agreements with Moscow.

ai_summary: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa met with Vladimir Putin in Moscow.
The meeting was their first since Bashar al-Assad was ousted.
Sharaa wants to "redefine" relations with Moscow.
He is expected to discuss Russia's military bases in Syria.
The talks underscore Moscow's efforts to safeguard its foothold.

items.content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday heard arguments for a second time in the legal fight over Louisiana's congressional map, a case that could impact the Voting Rights Act. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson has more.

items.title: Madagascar‚Äôs pattern of popular revolts gets its Gen Z update
items.standfirst: Madagascar is experiencing its fifth political crisis since the island gained independence from France in 1960. President Andry Rajoelina fled the country on Monday after weeks of protest led by social media group Gen Z Madagascar, creating a power vacuum that has allowed the military to claim power ‚Äì a situation that feels like d√©j√† vu.

items.title: Elite military unit says it has seized power in Madagascar
items.standfirst: Announcement comes after country‚Äôs parliament impeaches president after weeks of anti-government protestsAn elite military unit said it had taken power in Madagascar on Tuesday, after the country‚Äôs parliament impeached president Andry Rajoelina after weeks of anti-government protests.Rajoelina, who said on Monday in a Facebook Live video that he had gone into hiding after attempts to kill him, had refused demands to step down, but the demonstrators won the backing of the influential Capsat unit at the weekend. Continue reading...
items.content: Announcement comes after country‚Äôs parliament impeaches president after weeks of anti-government protestsAn elite military unit said it had taken power in Madagascar on Tuesday, after the country‚Äôs parliament impeached president Andry Rajoelina after weeks of anti-government protests.Rajoelina, who said on Monday in a Facebook Live video that he had gone into hiding after attempts to kill him, had refused demands to step down, but the demonstrators won the backing of the influential Capsat unit at the weekend. Continue reading...

items.title: Madagascar president says he fled country in fear for his life
items.standfirst: Andry Rajoelina does not announce resignation in speech broadcast on social media after military rebellionMadagascar‚Äôs president, Andry Rajoelina, said he had fled the country in fear for his life after a military rebellion but did not announce his resignation in a speech broadcast on social media late on Monday from an undisclosed location.The 51-year-old has faced weeks of gen Z-led anti-government protests, which reached a pivotal point on Saturday when an elite military unit joined the protests and called for the president and other ministers to step down. That prompted Rajoelina to say that an illegal attempt to seize power was under way in the Indian Ocean island and to leave the country. Continue reading...
items.content: Andry Rajoelina does not announce resignation in speech broadcast on social media after military rebellionMadagascar‚Äôs president, Andry Rajoelina, said he had fled the country in fear for his life after a military rebellion but did not announce his resignation in a speech broadcast on social media late on Monday from an undisclosed location.The 51-year-old has faced weeks of gen Z-led anti-government protests, which reached a pivotal point on Saturday when an elite military unit joined the protests and called for the president and other ministers to step down. That prompted Rajoelina to say that an illegal attempt to seize power was under way in the Indian Ocean island and to leave the country. Continue reading...

Parliament impeached President Rajoelina after anti-government protests.

clusters.title: Feds seize $15 billion in bitcoin after busting alleged global crypto scam
clusters.neutral_headline: Feds seize $15 billion in bitcoin after busting alleged global crypto scam

items.title: Feds seize $15 billion in bitcoin after busting alleged global crypto scam
items.standfirst: Federal prosecutors said a criminal network in Cambodia used forced labor to extract billions from victims in the U.S. and around the world.
items.content: Federal prosecutors said a criminal network in Cambodia used forced labor to extract billions from victims in the U.S. and around the world.

items.title: Feds seize $15 billion from alleged forced labor scam built on ‚Äúhuman suffering‚Äù
items.standfirst: Scams like this one net billions from well-educated victims.
items.content: Federal prosecutors have seized $15 billion from the alleged kingpin of an operation that used imprisoned laborers to trick unsuspecting people into making investments in phony funds, often after spending months faking romantic relationships with the victims. Such "pig butchering" scams have operated for years. They typically work when members of the operation initiate conversations with people on social media and then spend months messaging them. Often, the scammers pose as attractive individuals who feign romantic interest for the victim. Forced labor, phone farms, and human suffering Eventually, conversations turn to phony investment funds with the end goal of convincing the victim to transfer large amounts of bitcoin. In many cases, the scammers are trafficked and held against their will in compounds surrounded by fences and barbed wire.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: Federal prosecutors announced a criminal network in Cambodia.
The network allegedly used forced labor to extract funds.
Victims worldwide were targeted in the crypto scam.
The seized funds total $15 billion in bitcoin.
Scams like this one net billions from well-educated victims.

clusters.title: ChatGPT erotica coming soon with age verification, CEO says
clusters.neutral_headline: ChatGPT erotica coming soon with age verification, CEO says

items.title: ChatGPT erotica coming soon with age verification, CEO says
items.standfirst: Sam Altman claims new tools can detect mental distress while relaxing limits for adults.
items.content: On Tuesday, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced that the company will allow verified adult users to have erotic conversations with ChatGPT starting in December. The change represents a shift in how OpenAI approaches content restrictions, which the company had loosened in February but then dramatically tightened after an August lawsuit from parents of a teen who died by suicide after allegedly receiving encouragement from ChatGPT. "In December, as we roll out age-gating more fully and as part of our 'treat adult users like adults' principle, we will allow even more, like erotica for verified adults," Altman wrote in his post on X (formerly Twitter). The announcement follows OpenAI's recent hint that it would allow developers to create "mature" ChatGPT applications once the company implements appropriate age verification and controls. Altman explained that OpenAI had made ChatGPT "pretty restrictive to make sure we were being careful with mental health issues" but acknowledged this approach made the chatbot "less useful/enjoyable to many users who had no mental health problems." The CEO said the company now has new tools to better detect when users are experiencing mental distress, allowing OpenAI to relax restrictions in most cases.Read full article Comments

items.title: ChatGPT will soon allow erotica for verified adults, says OpenAI boss
items.standfirst: CEO Sam Altman says upcoming versions of the popular chatbot would enable it to behave in a more human-like way - "but only if you want it".
items.content: CEO Sam Altman says upcoming versions of the popular chatbot would enable it to behave in a more human-like way - "but only if you want it".

ai_summary: Sam Altman, OpenAI CEO, announced upcoming features.

Age verification will be required for access.
New tools will detect mental distress.
Limits for adults will be relaxed.

clusters.title: A New Attack Lets Hackers Steal 2-Factor Authentication Codes From Android Phones
clusters.neutral_headline: Hackers Can Steal 2FA Codes From Android Phones

items.title: A New Attack Lets Hackers Steal 2-Factor Authentication Codes From Android Phones
items.standfirst: The malicious app required to make a ‚ÄúPixnapping‚Äù attack work requires no permissions.
items.content: The malicious app required to make a ‚ÄúPixnapping‚Äù attack work requires no permissions.

items.title: Hackers can steal 2FA codes and private messages from Android phones
items.standfirst: Malicious app required to make "Pixnapping" attack work requires no permissions.
items.content: Android devices are vulnerable to a new attack that can covertly steal two-factor authentication codes, location timelines, and other private data in less than 30 seconds. The new attack, named Pixnapping by the team of academic researchers who devised it, requires a victim to first install a malicious app on an Android phone or tablet. The app, which requires no system permissions, can then effectively read data that any other installed app displays on the screen. Pixnapping has been demonstrated on Google Pixel phones and the Samsung Galaxy S25 phone and likely could be modified to work on other models with additional work. Google released mitigations last month, but the researchers said a modified version of the attack works even when the update is installed. Like taking a screenshot Pixnapping attacks begin with the malicious app invoking Android programming interfaces that cause the authenticator or other targeted apps to send sensitive information to the device screen. The malicious app then runs graphical operations on individual pixels of interest to the attacker. Pixnapping then exploits a side channel that allows the malicious app to map the pixels at those coordinates to letters, numbers, or shapes.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: A new attack allows hackers to steal 2FA codes.
The attack targets Android phones.
Hackers can also steal private messages.
A malicious app is required for the "Pixnapping" attack.
The app requires no permissions to function.

clusters.title: Man who set fire to Pennsylvania governor‚Äôs mansion jailed
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Jailed for Arson at Pennsylvania Governor's Mansion

items.title: Man who set fire to Pennsylvania governor‚Äôs mansion jailed
items.standfirst: Cody Balmer pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder for starting the fire in April while Shapiro and his family were inside. They escaped safely.
items.content: Cody Balmer pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder for starting the fire in April while Shapiro and his family were inside. They escaped safely.

items.title: Pennsylvania man pleads guilty in arson attack at governor‚Äôs mansion while Shapiro‚Äôs family slept
items.standfirst: Under a plea deal, Cody Balmer was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison.
items.content: A man who scaled an iron security fence in the middle of the night, eluded police and used beer bottles filled with gasoline to ignite the occupied Pennsylvania governor‚Äôs mansion pleaded guilty Tuesday to attempted murder and other charges. Cody Balmer, 38, also entered pleas to terrorism, 22 counts of arson, aggravated arson, burglary, aggravated assault of Gov. Josh Shapiro, 21 counts of reckless endangerment and loitering in the April 13 attack that did millions of dollars in damage to the state-owned brick building. Under a plea deal, Balmer was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison. Shapiro and members of his family had to be awakened and evacuated, but no one was injured. The multiple endangerment charges reflected the number of people in the residence at the time, including the governor‚Äôs family, guests and state troopers. The fire was set hours after they celebrated the Jewish holiday of Passover with a Seder in the residence. Prosecutors played video clips that showed Molotov cocktails going off and a figure inside and outside the residence. Judge Deborah Curcillo called the video ‚Äúhorrific‚Äù and ‚Äúvery frightening.‚Äù Balmer told police he planned to beat Shapiro with a small sledgehammer if he had encountered him after breaking into the building, according to court documents. Balmer turned himself in the next afternoon to face charges of attempted homicide, terrorism, aggravated arson and aggravated assault. Police say Balmer broke in through the southern wing of the residence, into a room often used to entertain crowds and display art. Investigators recovered two broken glass beer bottles containing gasoline. The fire charred walls, tables, buffet serving dishes, plates and a piano. Window panes and brick around doors and windows were also damaged. Shapiro's Jewish faith and the attack during the Passover weekend raised questions about Balmer's motivation, but Balmer told The Associated Press in a May letter from jail that had not been a factor in his decision. ‚ÄúHe can be Jewish, Muslim, or a purple people eater for all I care and as long as he leaves me and mine alone,‚Äù Balmer wrote. He said in a brief June 9 video interview from Camp Hill State Prison that he did think beforehand about whether children might be injured. ‚ÄúDoes anyone ever consider children?‚Äù Balmer said in June. ‚ÄúIt doesn't seem that way. I sure as hell did. I'm glad no one got hurt.‚Äù Asked why he felt Shapiro had somehow done him wrong, Balmer replied: ‚ÄúI'm not going to answer that.‚Äù Balmer‚Äôs mother said days after his arrest that she had tried to get him assistance for mental health issues, but ‚Äúnobody would help.‚Äù Court proceedings had been delayed while he received mental health treatment, his lawyer has said. At a court hearing a few days after the fire, Balmer told a judge he was an unemployed welder with no income or savings and ‚Äúa lot of children.‚Äù The residence, built in 1968, did not have sprinklers. Work to fix the damage and to bolster its security features continues.

ai_summary: Cody Balmer set fire to the Pennsylvania governor's mansion.
He pleaded guilty to arson and attempted murder.
The fire occurred while the governor and family were inside.
They escaped safely from the fire.
Balmer was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison.
